result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:04 PM Defendant Aaron A Sally appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan T Oswald in court for Aaron A Sally.  Attorney Rose Yanke in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Oswald is requesting that bond be further modified due to hardships of his family with the hurricane in Florida. He asks that it be reduced to $7500.00 with same conditions. Attorney Yanke states that she is opposed to bond being modifed any further.
Court denies motion to modify bond.
to Modify Bond

No controlled substances with a valid prescription.

1:20 PM Defendant Aaron A Sally in court.  Attorney Nathan T Oswald in court for Aaron A Sally.  Attorney Rose Yanke in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Oswald has filed a motion to modify bond. He asks that bond be reduced to $10,000 cash. State is opposed.
Court grants motion to modify bond. Bond is modified to $10,000. No possession of controlled substances without a prescription.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Second Motion to Modify Bond
Motion hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:54 AM Defendant Aaron A Sally appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan T Oswald in court for Aaron A Sally.  Attorney David Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant enters plea of not guilty to all counts. 
Attorney Oswald is requesting bond be reduced to $5,000 cash. Attorney Knaapen states he is opposed to modifying bond.
Court denies motion to modify bond.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
of Withdrawal of Speedy Trial Demand
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Arraignment on September 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Request for Discovery
Public defender order appointing counsel

2:06 PM Defendant Aaron A Sally in court, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes that he has received notice from Public Defender that they have not been able to find counsel for defendant, but he is eligible. They will continue looking for counsel. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today. 
Nicholas Brockman is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a police officer with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. On 8/16/22, he was dispatched to a verbal altercation in the City of Wisconsin Rapids. In route, he was advised that parties were leaving in a vehicle. He located the vehicle and two people were in the vehicle. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom as the driver of the vehicle. A bag of THC was found in the vehicle and a bag with crystal like material and drug paraphernalia was also found. The female in the vehicle indicated that the drugs belonged to defendant. Defendant was transported to the jail by Officer Jazdzewski. There was white crystal like material found in the squad car where defendant was sitting. The substance was falling out of his pants. When he was booked into the jail, more bags of crystal like material were found on defendant. The substances tested positive for methamphetamine, Fentanyl and THC.  Because of the amount of substances found, he feels it was intended to be distributed. Attorney Lambert asks Court to take judicial notice of Portage County case 14CF8, a prior drug conviction. Court takes judicial notice.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
SPD Status of Counsel Report
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:42 PM Defendant Aaron A Sally appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Austin M Mogard in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment. Bond is continued.
Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. WRPD 22-12417 $20,000.
Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
